intro: Calophanes nagchana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, tubular leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Calophanes nagchana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
